context_of_use: This use case allows power users to execute bulk actions on multiple items to improve efficiency.
stakeholders_and_interests: power user: Improve efficiency in handling multiple items.
system administrator: Ensure system stability during bulk operations.
description: Allow power users to execute bulk actions on multiple items to improve efficiency.
triggering_event: Power user initiates a request to handle bulk operations.
preconditions: Power user is logged into the system.
Power user has the necessary permissions to perform bulk operations.
postconditions: System reflects the changes made to the items.
assumptions: The system has the capability to handle bulk operations.
Power user has access to the items required for bulk operations.
requirements_met: The system shall allow power users to handle bulk operations efficiently.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of bulk operations supported by the system.
main_flow: 1. Power user initiates a request to handle bulk operations → System displays available items for bulk processing.
2. Power user selects multiple items for bulk operations → System confirms the selection.
3. Power user executes the bulk operation → System processes the request and updates the items accordingly.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): Power user cancels the selection → System returns to the item display without processing.
AF-2 (from Step 3): Power user requests a preview of changes before execution → System displays a summary of changes for confirmation.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If no items are selected → System displays an error message indicating that at least one item must be selected.
EF-2 (from Step 3): If the bulk operation fails due to system error → System logs the error and notifies the power user of the failure.
